articles.title: Apple’s iPhone Could Cost Up to 26% More. PCs and Other Hardware Will Soar, Too.
articles.content: FEATURE  Tech hardware prices will go higher—much, much higher—because of the Trump tariffs, new numbers from New Street Research show. The increases, as calculated by analyst Pierre Ferragu: Computers: 28% to 35%; high-end smartphones: 21% to 26%; computer servers and networking devices: 25% to 31%; and telecom equipment: 9% to 12%.
